quiz.title: Solving One-Variable Equations (Quiz 4)
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2 Quiz 4: Equations with Variables on Both Sides
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving Equations Where Variables Appear on Both Sides

questions.question: Solve: $12 - 5x = 3x + 28$
questions.explanation: Add $5x$ to both sides: $12 = 8x + 28$. Subtract $28$: $-16 = 8x$. Divide by $8$: $x = -2$.

questions.question: Solve: $2(3x + 1) = 6x - 5$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $6x + 2 = 6x - 5$. Subtract $6x$: $2 = -5$. False statement = no solution.

questions.question: Solve: $5(x - 2) + 10 = 5x$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $5x - 10 + 10 = 5x$ → $5x = 5x$. Subtract $5x$: $0 = 0$. True statement = identity with infinite solutions.

questions.question: Solve: $8x - 3 - 2x = 4x + 17$
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: $6x - 3 = 4x + 17$. Subtract $4x$: $2x - 3 = 17$. Add $3$: $2x = 20$. Divide: $x = 10$.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{x}{2} + 10 = \frac{x}{4} + 15$
questions.explanation: Multiply all terms by LCM 4: $2x + 40 = x + 60$. Subtract $x$: $x + 40 = 60$. Subtract $40$: $x = 20$.

questions.question: Solve: $4(x - 1) + 2x = 3(2x - 1) - 1$
questions.explanation: Left side: $4x - 4 + 2x = 6x - 4$. Right side: $6x - 3 - 1 = 6x - 4$. So $6x - 4 = 6x - 4$. Subtract $6x$: $-4 = -4$. True statement = identity with infinite solutions.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered equations with variables on both sides, including identities and no-solution cases.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand the process but review sign management and special case identification.
scoreMessages.50: A fair attempt. Focus on: distributing carefully, moving variable terms, checking for identities/no solution.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Strategy: get all variable terms on one side, constants on the other, then solve.
